notes.text:
An update for libvncserver is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
LibVNCServer is a C library that enables you to implement VNC server functionality into own programs.

Security Fix(es):

* libvncserver: uninitialized memory contents are vulnerable to Information Leak (CVE-2018-21247)

* libvncserver: buffer overflow in ConnectClientToUnixSock() (CVE-2019-20839)

* libvncserver: libvncserver/rfbregion.c has a NULL pointer dereference (CVE-2020-14397)

* libvncserver: libvncclient/rfbproto.c does not limit TextChat size (CVE-2020-14405)

* libvncserver: libvncserver/rfbserver.c has a divide by zero which could result in DoS (CVE-2020-25708)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.

Additional Changes:

For detailed information on changes in this release, see the Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.4 Release Notes linked from the References section.
notes.title: Details

cwe.name: Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor

notes.text: An issue was discovered in LibVNCServer before 0.9.13. There is an information leak (of uninitialized memory contents) in the libvncclient/rfbproto.c ConnectToRFBRepeater function.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: libvncserver: uninitialized memory contents are vulnerable to Information Leak
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: libvncserver: uninitialized memory contents are vulnerable to Information Leak

cwe.name: Buffer Copy without Checking Size of Input ('Classic Buffer Overflow')

notes.text: libvncclient/sockets.c in LibVNCServer before 0.9.13 has a buffer overflow via a long socket filename.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: This is only an issue if the "ConnectClientToUnixSock()" function is used directly with an overly long socket name. It's more common that the "ConnectToRFBServer()" function is used, which would prevent exploiting this flaw as it performs additional checks. Additionally, the buffer overflow is caught by compiled-in buffer overflow checks, limiting the impact to a crash.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

notes.text: A divide by zero flaw was found in libvncserver. This flaw allows a malicious client to send a specially crafted message that, when processed by the VNC server, leads to a floating-point exception, resulting in a denial of service. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability.
notes.title: Vulnerability description
